parts.text: {"word":"negotiability","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"交渉可能性、交渉の余地、譲歩の余地、流通性（手形・小切手などの）","english_definition":"the quality of being open to discussion and modification; the ability to be transferred to another party (as in the case of a check or bill).","examples":[{"sentence":"The negotiability of the price was a key factor in closing the deal.","translation":"価格の交渉可能性が、取引を成立させるための重要な要素だった。"},{"sentence":"The negotiability of the contract terms allowed both parties to reach a mutually beneficial agreement.","translation":"契約条件の交渉可能性のおかげで、両当事者は互いに有益な合意に達することができた。"},{"sentence":"The negotiability of the check made it easy to transfer funds.","translation":"その小切手の流通性のおかげで、資金の移動が容易になった。"}],"collocations":["price negotiability (価格交渉可能性)","term negotiability (条件交渉可能性)","contract negotiability (契約交渉可能性)","check negotiability (小切手の流通性)","bill negotiability (手形の流通性)"],"synonyms":["flexibility","adaptability","openness","transferability","convertibility"],"antonyms":["inflexibility","rigidity","non-negotiability","immutability"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"(稀) 交渉できる性質、交渉に適した性質","english_definition":"(rare) the quality of being suitable for negotiation.","examples":[{"sentence":"The negotiability of the issue made it a good candidate for mediation.","translation":"その問題は交渉に適した性質を持っていたため、調停の良い候補となった。"}],"collocations":["issue negotiability (問題の交渉適性)"],"synonyms":["suitability for negotiation","amenability to negotiation"],"antonyms":["unsuitability for negotiation"]}],"etymology":{"value":"negotiable + -ity","priority":"★★★"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/nɪˌɡoʊʃiəˈbɪləti/","syllables":"ni-go-ti-a-bil-i-ty"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"negotiabilities (rare)"},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"\"Negotiability\" refers to the extent to which something can be discussed and changed. It is often used in the context of business deals, contracts, and prices. In finance, it can also refer to the ease with which a financial instrument can be transferred to another party. The term is crucial in understanding the flexibility and adaptability of agreements and financial transactions.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The negotiability was high.","correct":"✓ The degree of negotiability was high. / ✓ The level of negotiability was high.","note":"\"Negotiability\" is a quality, so you can't say \"The negotiability was high.\" Instead, you can say \"The degree of negotiability was high\" or \"The level of negotiability was high.\" Alternatively, rephrase to use \"negotiable,\" e.g., \"The terms were highly negotiable.\""},{"incorrect":"✗ The negotiability of him was good.","correct":"✓ His negotiability was good. / ✓ He was a good negotiator.","note":"\"Negotiability\" refers to the quality of something being negotiable, not the skill of a person. To describe a person's skill, use \"negotiator\" or describe them as \"negotiable\" (though this is less common)."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["negotiable (adjective)","negotiate (verb)","negotiation (noun)","negotiator (noun)"],"phrases":["non-negotiable (adjective)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1","frequency_google_ngram":"Relatively low frequency","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"\"Negotiability\" is a formal term that describes how open something is to being discussed and changed. It's often used in business or legal contexts when talking about contracts or deals. It means that the different parts of an agreement can be changed or adjusted through discussion. It also refers to the ease with which something like a check or bond can be transferred to someone else. It's not a word you'd use in everyday conversation, but it's important in professional settings where agreements and finances are discussed.","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The **negotiability** of the salary was limited due to budget constraints.","translation":"予算の制約により、給与の交渉可能性は限られていた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"交渉可能性 (給与)"},{"sentence":"The high **negotiability** of the bond made it attractive to investors.","translation":"その債券の高い流通性は、投資家にとって魅力的だった。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"流通性 (債券)"},{"sentence":"The **negotiability** of the terms ensured a fair agreement for both parties.","translation":"条件の交渉可能性は、両当事者にとって公正な合意を保証した。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"交渉可能性 (条件)"}]}
